request_body.message: what is mitsolab? can you tell me the pricing and use cases? and then talk about how it works?

response_json.reply:
Mitsolab is an AI agent service for customer support and personal agents for individuals and businesses—hosted agents that automate support, run workflows, and integrate with your systems.

Pricing & main plan features
- Free — $0
  - 50 messages/month
  - 1 AI agent
  - 1 member
  - 400 KB per agent
  - Top LLM models (basic)
- Hobby — $29/month (or $290/year)
  - Everything in Free +
  - 2,500 messages/month
  - 1 AI agent
  - 2 members
  - Full integrations, API access
  - 10 AI Actions per agent
  - 4 behaviour policies
  - Basic analytics
  - 25 MB per agent
- Growth — $119/month (or $1,190/year)
  - Everything in Hobby +
  - 10,000 messages/month
  - 2 AI agents
  - 3 members
  - CRM & ticketing
  - 10 behaviour policies
  - 10 AI Actions per agent
  - 50 MB per agent
- Pro — $299/month (or $2,990/year)
  - Everything in Growth +
  - 40,000 messages/month
  - 5 members
  - 1 AI agent (note: Pro says 1 AI agent in chunk? — confirm in signup)
  - 15 AI Actions per agent
  - Advanced analytics
  - Ticketing system
  - 80 MB per agent

(If you want, I can confirm exact agent/member counts for Pro before you purchase.)

Common use cases
- Customer support automation: 24/7 conversational support, ticket routing and escalation.
- Personal assistants: calendar, reminders, email drafting, task automation.
- Internal helpdesks: onboarding, knowledge base queries, IT/HR triage.
- Sales/CRM augmentation: lead qualification, follow-ups, note generation.
- Workflow automation: connect APIs, run automations via AI Actions.
- Prototyping AI features or embedding conversational agents via API.

How it works (overview)
1. Sign up and pick a plan.
2. Create one or more AI agents and configure their behavior (policies, prompts, persona).
3. Connect integrations (APIs, CRM, ticketing, email) and set up credentials.
4. Define AI Actions (automated tasks the agent can run) and limits.
5. Train or upload data per agent (storage quotas apply) and set message quotas.
6. Deploy the agent to channels (web widget, API, messaging) and monitor via analytics and logs.
7. Scale or change plan as usage grows.

If you want, I can recommend a plan based on your expected monthly message volume, number of agents, and integrations. Which of those best describes your needs?
